comments.author: Amy
comments.content: This sounds like a science experiment.  My first question was wouldn't it taste salty?  (Who would want salty ice cream).  But it sounds like you avoided that problem.  I've never had any ice cream that inventive, but it sounds intriguing.

comments.author: Ivy Manning
comments.content: Mmm, pretzel flavored ice cream. You could bake the extras to dry them out, smash them and use them to bread something, eggplant, salsify?

comments.author: Xiaolu @ 6 Bittersweets
comments.content: This sounds fascinating, Michael.  I bet the sweet n' savory mix is delightful.  Wish I had an ice cream maker!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @Xiaolu - with all the beautiful food you make, you don't have an ice cream maker? This is terrible!  I'd love to see what you would make. This is the one I have; it works great and is pretty inexpensive. http://amzn.to/dkhnTQ

comments.author: Sarina
comments.content: Best dessert ever.  seriously!  Please make it again!!

comments.author: leighannet
comments.content: very cool! can you sub anything (coconut milk?) to make it dairy free?? my little girl is allergic - much to my milk and cheese-loving dismay :(

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content: I am not sure that I could eat this, I only love pretzels with beer... ;-)

comments.author: Carolyn Jung
comments.content: Salty and sweet. Crunchy and creamy. It's every taste sensation in one lovely decadent glass. ;)

comments.author: Brilynn
comments.content: Recipes like this are why I love making ice cream, there are just so many awesome flavour possibilities. This looks great!

comments.author: jodye @ 'scend food
comments.content: Wow, pretzel ice cream sounds like a dream, a really delicious dream!

comments.author: Jenny
comments.content: I inadvertently came upon the pretzel/ice cream combination myself a few weeks ago. We were on a long drive, and after a bathroom break at a gas station, bought our daughters a bag of butter flavored pretzels, and a pint of vanilla ice cream to be shared. Curious, my husband added a pretzel to his ice cream. It was really, really good. The fake butter flavor really was excellent with the vanilla as well. I suppose maybe the caramel would be the natural analogue to that.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That's an interesting idea! There is definitely some flavor left in them.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I've had some delicious coconut-milk based ice creams but haven't ventured to make one yet. It is possible the coconut flavor might overpower the pretzel though. If you try it, let us know how it turns out!

comments.author: Gali
comments.content: This sounds so interesting because I honestly had never thought of doing something like infusing pretzels. But really I bet it's something to try!

comments.author: Aggie
comments.content: oh my goodness this looks amazing!!  My all time favorite Ben and Jerry's flavor is Chubby Hubby and I don't even think they make it anymore but it had pretzels mixed in.  DELISH!  I want to make this!

comments.author: Grubarazzi (@Grubarazzi)
comments.content: The flaky sea salt is key! Oh, this sounds heavenly.

comments.author: Judy G
comments.content:
Gave this a try today and it is heavenly! I'm about to finish the entire container! :D

The soaked pretzels were made into a [bread] pudding. I served it with grated aged cheddar (Kerrygold). Really good :)

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Nice! I love the use for the leftover pretzels too, very cool.

comments.author: Carolyn
comments.content: I made this pretzel ice cream last weekend and I loved it! I didn’t use the salt flakes and the mini pretzels add a tiny bit of salt on them so I don’t think I needed it.  Let me tell you...delicious!  I absolutely love this ice cream!  Five Stars!!!
